item.title: Black Ops 7 Release Date Remains Unchanged
item.content:encoded:
Despite rumours, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will release on its previously revealed release date, November 14, 2025.

For those who don‚Äôt know, a claim from yesterday stated that there was evidence of a potential release date change for Black Ops 7, with the game arriving a week earlier. However, Treyarch has debunked this claim, revealing that the release date for the upcoming title remains on track.

Black Ops 7 To Release on November 14 As Planned

The latest post from Treyarch on X (formerly Twitter) discusses the release date for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. The developers have stated, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre less than a month away from #BlackOps7‚Äôs launch on November 14,‚Äù which clears up any doubts about a potential announcement of a release date change. The post also talks about their newest dev talk dropping today, October 21, along with more juicy multiplayer updates from the beta.

Talking about Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta, it was revealed that RICOCHET Anti-Cheat achieved the strongest Beta results in Call of Duty history. 99% of the matches were cheater-free, and cheaters were detected within three matches. This is excellent news for fans of the series, as Call of Duty has been one of the franchise‚Äôs biggest victims of in-game cheating. Hopefully, the case remains the same during launch.

In other news, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 developers have announced that the game will feature non-disbanding multiplayer lobbies at launch. Additionally, the game didn‚Äôt include a Wall Run feature due to its timeline. Are you happy that Black Ops 7‚Äôs release date remains unchanged?  Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Helldivers 2 devs will look into GameGuard anti-cheat. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
